cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
Whose first solo UK number 1 single was I Only Have Eyes for You in September 1975?
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
To determine whose first solo UK number 1 single was "I Only Have Eyes for You" in September 1975, I need to recall the artists associated with that song. "I Only Have Eyes for You" is a well-known song that has been covered by various artists. However, the version that reached number 1 in the UK in September 1975 was performed by Art Garfunkel, who is known for being part of the duo Simon & Garfunkel. This song marked his first solo number 1 single after the duo's split. 

Answer:
Art Garfunkel

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
Whose first solo UK number 1 single was I Only Have Eyes for You in September 1975?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['I Only Have Eyes for You is an album by American pop singer Johnny Mathis that was released on May 10, 1976, by Columbia Records and included two new songs, "Yellow Roses on Her Gown" and "Ooh What We Do", which was written specifically for him, as well as a contemporary arrangement of the 1934 title track that foreshadowed his recordings of standards that incorporated a disco beat ("Begin the Beguine", "Night and Day") a few years later.\n', 'A recording of the song by Art Garfunkel was a number one hit on the UK Singles Chart in October 1975 for two weeks. The song was his first hit as a solo artist in the UK. In the US, the song reached number 18 on the U.S. "Billboard" Hot 100 and #1 on the "Billboard" Adult Contemporary chart. The B-side of the single release was "Looking for the Right One," a song written and later recorded by Stephen Bishop. Garfunkel performed "I Only Have Eyes for You" on the second episode of "Saturday Night Live".\n', '"I Only Have Eyes for You" is a romantic love song by composer Harry Warren and lyricist Al Dubin, written for the film "Dames" (1934) where it was introduced by Dick Powell and Ruby Keeler. The song is a jazz standard, and has been covered by numerous musicians. Successful recordings of the song have been made by Ben Selvin (in 1934), Peggy Lee (in 1947), The Lettermen (in 1966), Art Garfunkel (in 1975), The Three Degrees (in 1982), and Rod Stewart (in 2003), among others. Perhaps the best known and most acclaimed version is the "otherworldly" 1959 recording by doo-wop artists The Flamingos, which was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 2003, and listed as #157 in "Rolling Stone" magazine\'s "500 Greatest Songs of All Time (2004)."\n', 'BULLET::::- January 21, 1976 – "I Only Have Eyes for You"\n', 'I Only Have Eyes for You is the third album by Lester Bowie recorded for ECM and the debut album of his "Brass Fantasy" group. It was released in 1985 and features performances by Bowie, Vincent Chancey, Craig Harris, Steve Turre, Malachi Thompson, Stanton Davis, Bob Stewart and Phillip Wilson.\n', 'In 1959 their biggest hit was "I Only Have Eyes For You" which remains their most popular song, being used in film soundtracks and on compilation albums to this date.\n', 'I Only Have Eyes for You is an album by saxophonist Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis recorded in 1962 for the Prestige label.\n', 'BULLET::::- Johnny Mathis included the song on his album "I Only Have Eyes for You" in 1976.\n', 'BULLET::::- "I Only Have Eyes for You" (Johnny Mathis album), 1976\n', 'BULLET::::- "I Only Have Eyes for You" (Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis album), a 1962 album by saxophonist Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis featuring a version of the song\n']

5. **Comparative Analysis**:

6. **Temporal Reasoning**:

Art Garfunkel

question_info.question: Whose first solo UK number 1 single was I Only Have Eyes for You in September 1975?
passages:
I Only Have Eyes for You is an album by American pop singer Johnny Mathis that was released on May 10, 1976, by Columbia Records and included two new songs, "Yellow Roses on Her Gown" and "Ooh What We Do", which was written specifically for him, as well as a contemporary arrangement of the 1934 title track that foreshadowed his recordings of standards that incorporated a disco beat ("Begin the Beguine", "Night and Day") a few years later.
A recording of the song by Art Garfunkel was a number one hit on the UK Singles Chart in October 1975 for two weeks. The song was his first hit as a solo artist in the UK. In the US, the song reached number 18 on the U.S. "Billboard" Hot 100 and #1 on the "Billboard" Adult Contemporary chart. The B-side of the single release was "Looking for the Right One," a song written and later recorded by Stephen Bishop. Garfunkel performed "I Only Have Eyes for You" on the second episode of "Saturday Night Live".
"I Only Have Eyes for You" is a romantic love song by composer Harry Warren and lyricist Al Dubin, written for the film "Dames" (1934) where it was introduced by Dick Powell and Ruby Keeler. The song is a jazz standard, and has been covered by numerous musicians. Successful recordings of the song have been made by Ben Selvin (in 1934), Peggy Lee (in 1947), The Lettermen (in 1966), Art Garfunkel (in 1975), The Three Degrees (in 1982), and Rod Stewart (in 2003), among others. Perhaps the best known and most acclaimed version is the "otherworldly" 1959 recording by doo-wop artists The Flamingos, which was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 2003, and listed as #157 in "Rolling Stone" magazine's "500 Greatest Songs of All Time (2004)."
BULLET::::- January 21, 1976 – "I Only Have Eyes for You"
I Only Have Eyes for You is the third album by Lester Bowie recorded for ECM and the debut album of his "Brass Fantasy" group. It was released in 1985 and features performances by Bowie, Vincent Chancey, Craig Harris, Steve Turre, Malachi Thompson, Stanton Davis, Bob Stewart and Phillip Wilson.
In 1959 their biggest hit was "I Only Have Eyes For You" which remains their most popular song, being used in film soundtracks and on compilation albums to this date.
I Only Have Eyes for You is an album by saxophonist Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis recorded in 1962 for the Prestige label.
BULLET::::- Johnny Mathis included the song on his album "I Only Have Eyes for You" in 1976.
BULLET::::- "I Only Have Eyes for You" (Johnny Mathis album), 1976
BULLET::::- "I Only Have Eyes for You" (Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis album), a 1962 album by saxophonist Eddie "Lockjaw" Davis featuring a version of the song
